Based on your interest in transhumanism and engaging plots, I'd recommend you to watch "The Matrix"! In this film, Keanu Reeves plays Neo, a computer hacker who uncovers a shocking truth about our world being an elaborate deception by an evil cyber-intelligence. It's a thought-provoking movie that explores themes of technology and humanity in an enthralling way.

Another film you might enjoy is "Avatar". This visually stunning sci-fi epic revolves around a paraplegic marine, Sam Worthington, who forms a deep connection with the native inhabitants of the moon Pandora while on a mission, raising questions about humanity and its relationship with nature. Both movies offer captivating stories that delve into transhumanism and technology's impact on our lives. Enjoy watching!

I'd highly recommend "Saving Private Ryan" if you enjoyed the intense, realistic war scenes in The Matrix. Tom Hanks delivers an outstanding performance as a soldier tasked with rescuing his brother behind enemy lines during World War II. It's a powerful and thought-provoking film that's sure to keep you engaged.

Alternatively, "Princess Mononoke" might also appeal to you, especially if you enjoyed the concept of thinking and matrices in The Matrix. This animated film by renowned director Hayao Miyazaki explores themes of nature versus industry and features stunning animation that beautifully blends traditional Japanese art with modern storytelling.

I'd highly recommend "A Farewell to Arms" if you enjoy stories set in the war genre. Based on a novel by Ernest Hemingway, it tells a poignant tale of love amidst the chaos of World War 1, with Geraldine Chaplin and Ben Ellison delivering compelling performances as the lead characters.

If you're more interested in a contemporary war story, "American Sniper" might be a good fit for you. Directed by Clint Eastwood, it stars Bradley Cooper as a real-life Navy SEAL sniper, showcasing the complexities of war and its impact on those who serve.
